001package squidpony.squidgrid;
002
003/**
004 * Represents the eight grid directions and the deltaX, deltaY values associated
005 * with those directions.
006 *
007 * The grid referenced has x positive to the right and y positive downwards on
008 * screen.
009 *
010 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
011 */
012public enum Direction {
013
014    UP(0, -1), DOWN(0, 1), LEFT(-1, 0), RIGHT(1, 0), UP_LEFT(-1, -1), UP_RIGHT(1, -1), DOWN_LEFT(-1, 1), DOWN_RIGHT(1, 1), NONE(0, 0);
015    /**
016     * An array which holds only the four cardinal directions.
017     */
018    public static final Direction[] CARDINALS = {UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT};
019    /**
020     * An array which holds only the four diagonal directions.
021     */
022    public static final Direction[] DIAGONALS = {UP_LEFT, UP_RIGHT, DOWN_LEFT, DOWN_RIGHT};
023    /**
024     * An array which holds all eight OUTWARDS directions.
025     */
026    public static final Direction[] OUTWARDS = {UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, UP_LEFT, UP_RIGHT, DOWN_LEFT, DOWN_RIGHT};
027    /**
028     * The x coordinate difference for this direction.
029     */
030    public final int deltaX;
031    /**
032     * The y coordinate difference for this direction.
033     */
034    public final int deltaY;
035
036    /**
037     * Returns the direction that most closely matches the input.
038     *
039     * This can be used to get the primary magnitude intercardinal direction
040     * from an origin point to an event point, such as a mouse click on a grid.
041     *
042     * If the point given is exactly on a boundary between directions then the
043     * direction clockwise is returned.
044     *
045     * @param x
046     * @param y
047     * @return
048     */
049    static public Direction getDirection(int x, int y) {
050        if (x == 0 && y == 0) {
051            return NONE;
052        }
053
054        double angle = Math.atan2(y, x);
055        double degree = Math.toDegrees(angle);
056        degree += 450;//rotate to all positive and 0 is up
057        degree %= 360;//normalize
058        if (degree < 22.5) {
059            return UP;
060        } else if (degree < 67.5) {
061            return UP_RIGHT;
062        } else if (degree < 112.5) {
063            return RIGHT;
064        } else if (degree < 157.5) {
065            return DOWN_RIGHT;
066        } else if (degree < 202.5) {
067            return DOWN;
068        } else if (degree < 247.5) {
069            return DOWN_LEFT;
070        } else if (degree < 292.5) {
071            return LEFT;
072        } else if (degree < 337.5) {
073            return UP_LEFT;
074        } else {
075            return UP;
076        }
077    }
078
079    /**
080     * Returns the direction that most closely matches the input.
081     *
082     * This can be used to get the primary magnitude cardinal direction from an
083     * origin point to an event point, such as a mouse click on a grid.
084     *
085     * If the point given is directly diagonal then the direction clockwise is
086     * returned.
087     *
088     * @param x
089     * @param y
090     * @return
091     */
092    static public Direction getCardinalDirection(int x, int y) {
093        if (x == 0 && y == 0) {
094            return NONE;
095        }
096
097        int absx = Math.abs(x);
098
099        if (y > absx) {
100            return UP;
101        }
102
103        int absy = Math.abs(y);
104
105        if (absy > absx) {
106            return DOWN;
107        }
108
109        if (x > 0) {
110            if (-y == x) {//on diagonal
111                return DOWN;
112            }
113            return RIGHT;
114        }
115
116        if (y == x) {//on diagonal
117            return UP;
118        }
119        return LEFT;
120
121    }
122
123    /**
124     * Returns the Direction one step clockwise including diagonals.
125     *
126     * If considering only Cardinal directions, calling this twice will get the
127     * next clockwise cardinal direction.
128     *
129     * @return
130     */
131    public Direction clockwise() {
132        switch (this) {
133            case UP:
134                return UP_RIGHT;
135            case DOWN:
136                return DOWN_LEFT;
137            case LEFT:
138                return UP_LEFT;
139            case RIGHT:
140                return DOWN_RIGHT;
141            case UP_LEFT:
142                return UP;
143            case UP_RIGHT:
144                return RIGHT;
145            case DOWN_LEFT:
146                return LEFT;
147            case DOWN_RIGHT:
148                return DOWN;
149            case NONE:
150            default:
151                return NONE;
152        }
153    }
154
155    /**
156     * Returns the Direction one step counterclockwise including diagonals.
157     *
158     * If considering only Cardinal directions, calling this twice will get the
159     * next counterclockwise cardinal direction.
160     *
161     * @return
162     */
163    public Direction counterClockwise() {
164        switch (this) {
165            case UP:
166                return UP_LEFT;
167            case DOWN:
168                return DOWN_RIGHT;
169            case LEFT:
170                return DOWN_LEFT;
171            case RIGHT:
172                return UP_RIGHT;
173            case UP_LEFT:
174                return LEFT;
175            case UP_RIGHT:
176                return UP;
177            case DOWN_LEFT:
178                return DOWN;
179            case DOWN_RIGHT:
180                return RIGHT;
181            case NONE:
182            default:
183                return NONE;
184        }
185    }
186
187    /**
188     * Returns the direction directly opposite of this one.
189     *
190     * @return
191     */
192    public Direction opposite() {
193        switch (this) {
194            case UP:
195                return DOWN;
196            case DOWN:
197                return UP;
198            case LEFT:
199                return RIGHT;
200            case RIGHT:
201                return LEFT;
202            case UP_LEFT:
203                return DOWN_RIGHT;
204            case UP_RIGHT:
205                return DOWN_LEFT;
206            case DOWN_LEFT:
207                return UP_RIGHT;
208            case DOWN_RIGHT:
209                return UP_LEFT;
210            case NONE:
211            default:
212                return NONE;
213        }
214    }
215
216    private Direction(int x, int y) {
217        this.deltaX = x;
218        this.deltaY = y;
219    }
220}
